title: William Brouncker, 2nd Viscount Brouncker
summary: William Brouncker, 2nd Viscount Brouncker, FRS (1620 â€“ 5 April 1684) was an Irish born mathematician who introduced Brouncker's formula, and was the first president of the Royal Society. He was also a civil servant, serving as a commissioner of the Royal Navy. He was a friend and colleague of Samuel Pepys, and features prominently in the Great Diary.
